item.title: HOLIDAY SALE: LIKE US ON FB, ALL BSA PRODUCTS $12
item.description:
Happy Holidays! BSA is happy to announce the beginning of its Holiday Sale for all products: umbrellas, tote bags, and a variety of t-shirts. By liking Brown Student Agencies on Facebook, you can purchase any of these items for only $12! Now you can buy the Brown gear your friends and family want, but for less $$!

To receive the discount, go to BSA's Facebook page, like it, and click the "tshirt coupon" tab. Then just print the coupon and present it at the info desk! Happy holiday shopping!

item.title: Boren Scholarship Info Session
item.description: If you are interested in learning about the Boren Scholarship, plan to attend this info session in the Office of International Programs on Thursday, December 13, 2012 at 4:00pm in JWW 440.

item.title: Reminder: Workday 18 System Update
item.description: To allow for the release of the Workday 18 update, the Workday system will be unavailable beginning Friday, December 14, at 9:00pm. Faculty and staff may log back into Workday on Monday, December 17, at 8:00am. Please plan accordingly.

item.title: **Christmas Party**TOMORROW
item.description:
Come celebrate Christmas TOMORROW, 12/14 @ 7:30PM in the warm, historic Judson House (168 Lloyd Ave., 2 blocks past CVS) with good food, good fun, and good company. We will be serving classic Christmas goodies from different parts of the world, playing games, decorating a Christmas tree and reading the Christmas story. There'll be a gingerbread house making competition, so come ready with ideas, and bring teammates! All are invited! FREE!

WHEN: 7:30-9:30 PM
WHERE: 168 Lloyd Ave.

item.title: BEO Intn'tl Internships, Application deadline
item.description: If you are a BEO sophomore or junior interested in the BEO International Internship program, this is just a reminder that applications are due this Friday, 12/14. You can submit applications via email to christine_sprovieri@brown.edu or drop them off at the BEO office in Sayles 015.

item.title: Brown Jug Tradition Issue: It's Out Now!
item.description: Check out the Brown Jug Traditions Issue. The Brown Jug is a humor magazine--it's as old as time! Read the newest one, all the magazine stands have it.

item.title: LAST DAY TO GET YOUR BASKETBALL TICKETS
item.description: Today, December 13, is the last day to pick up your FREE men's basketball ticket for the home game against Providence College on December 28. Please stop at the Brown Ticket Office before 5 p.m. with the Brown Card to pick up your ticket.

item.title: GIFT SALE for Mali Health Wed. and Thurs. in JWW
item.description: Super cool t-shirts, beautiful jewelry, donations to an awesome cause -- find them all at the Mali Health Organizing Project's gift sale in the JWW lobby this Wednesday (12/13) and Thursday (12/14) from 11am-1pm. Come help us raise money to build a maternity ward in West Africa, while getting great, inexpensive gifts for all of the people in your life!

item.title: Apply to the BDH Editorial Page Board!
item.description: We are currently accepting applications for next semester's BDH Editorial Page Board! The Editorial Page Board is comprised of five members, and we are responsible for the editorials, which appear each daily issue of the Herald. If you have a strong interest in Brown, local and national issues, we encourage you to apply! For an application, please contact Daniel_Jeon@brown.edu. We look forward to reading your application!

item.title: Apply: Summer@Brown and Sports Camp RA Postions
item.description:
Applications are now being accepted for Summer@Brown and Sports Camp RA positions. The deadline for applications is February 4

For more information and application materials visit: http://reslife.brown.edu/summer_staff/selection/index.html

item.title: selfservice.brown.edu with SHAG tonight, 7pm
item.description: The SHAG Series of Unmentionable Events presents selfservice.brown.edu, tonight, Thursday, 12/13, at 7pm! Join SHAG to discuss + demystify masturbation. Is it something I only do alone? What role can it play with a partner? How can you masturbate when you have a roommate? What are the health benefits? Get these + your other questions answered. FREE pizza + safer sex supplies! Just a few spots left! To register, e-mail shag@brown.edu. Location will be sent with your registration confirmation.

item.title: ------------->EDIT and WRITE for THE TRIPLE HELIX!
item.description:
Ever read an article in Time or the NY Times and thought "WOW. That's so cool"? WELL, you're in luck! The Triple Helix is looking for EDITORS and WRITERS interested in SCIENCE, SOCIAL ISSUES or LAW!

If you want to edit feature-length articles and work closely with writers, email BROWN@TheTripleHelix.ORG for an application to be an Associate Editor in the Spring! Also, if you're also interested in writing, shoot us an email and we'll contact you next semester with details! DO IT!

item.title: BIOL1200: Protein Biophysics & Structural Biology
item.description: Spring 2013: BIOL1200, Protein Biophysics & Structural Biology: The field of structural biology is one of the most rapidly developing fields. Structure Based Drug Design has already lead to multiple drugs such as HIV protease inhibitor cocktails, flu, and arthritis medicine. Prereq: BIOL 0280. If interested please come to the first meeting on Tuesday 1/29 from 8:30am-9:00am at BioMed Center (BMC) Room 305. Regular class days and time will be determined based on the needs of the students.

item.title: Call for submissions: 2013 Pingree Prize
item.description:
The David Pingree Prize in Ancient Science and Intellectual History
Instituted by Isabelle Pingree and Brown University in 2011 to honor the distinguished career of her late husband Professor David E. Pingree, University Professor and Professor of the History of Mathematics and of Classics at Brown University until his death in 2005.

item.title: Boren Scholarship Info Session
item.description: If you are interested in learning about the Boren Scholarship, plan to attend this info session in the Office of International Programs on Wednesday, December 12, 2012 at 12:00 noon in JWW 440.

item.title: Pick up a Copy of the Brown Political Review!
item.description:
Want to read what your fellow peers have to say about the current state of local, national, and international affairs?

If so, then pick up a copy of the Brown Political Review, a political magazine sponsored by the Political Theory Project. Copies of the magazine will be available this week in Faunce, J. Walter Wilson, and in the dining halls. Get your copy today!

item.title: Cookies, Hot Chocolate, Crafts: Study Break TODAY!
item.description: Don't let finals get you down! Give yourself a break from studying and come join us for Meeting St. cookies, hot chocolate, and simple crafts. It's a perfect way to unwind and recharge. Drop in from 1-4PM TODAY (12/12/12) at Faunce Memorial Room 229. Brought to you by The Student Volunteers for the Samaritans of Rhode Island.

item.title: Food Recovery Network: Snack Donation Frenzy!
item.description: (FRN- part of HOPE) Send some holiday cheer to the women's and children's shelter and give back to the Providence community by donating snacks at Jo's! Thursday, December 13th from 8-9 PM, you can use up some extra meal credits, purchase something extra or buy something to use your whole credit. FRN volunteers will be standing by to answer any questions

item.title: BOOKSTORE HOLIDAY SALE ENDS SUNDAY
item.description:
The Brown Bookstore Holiday Sale continues through Sunday, December 16th, featuring discounts from 20% to 50% on a wide variety of merchandise!

Sale is in-store only. Some exclusions apply. Quantities are limited.

For more information call x3-3168.

Hours:
Mon–Fri 7:30–8 • Sat 10–8 • Sun 10–6
(Textbook Department & Technology Center close at 6pm daily)

item.title: Write & Make Art for Watershed Journal this Winter
item.description: Watershed Journal, Brown and RISD's publication of Environment and Culture, seeks submissions of Art, Photography, Poetry, and Prose. Have an idea for a piece? E-mail us at Watershed_Journal@brown.edu with thoughts and questions. We would love to work with you over winter break to create something wonderful.

item.title: /~/~/~/~/~/~ LEAVETAKERS PIZZA STUDY BREAK 1 PM
item.description: Calling past, present, potential leavetakers AND CATS to come to the Curricular Resource Center, Room 228 in Faunce, TODAY 12/12 at 1 PM - 2 PM for a PIZZA STUDY BREAK!

item.title: JCB Fellows Lunch! (12/12)
item.description:
The John Carter Brown Library will host a lunch chat at Brown RISD Hillel on December 12th at 12:00 p.m. Linda Sturtz, from Beloit College, will give a talk entitled, "Sett-Girls, Calemba, and Myal: Contextualizing African-Jamaican Women´s Musical Processions in the Pre-Emancipation Period". Linda is the National Endowment for the Humanities Fellow at the John Carter Brown Library.

Please bring your own lunch to Hillel. The talk will begin at 12:30 p.m

item.title: Study Break With A4 TODAY (12/12)
item.description:
Come out and take a break from work with the Pan Asian Council (PAC) and representatives of the Asian/Asian American Alumni Alliance (A4), as we video chat with Channa Srey (Outreach Officer). This is a great chance for you to learn more about A4 and opportunities for you to get involved with A4.

There will be plenty of HOT CHOCOLATE and MEETING STREET cookies for everyone. The event is open to ALL (especially Seniors)!

WHERE: Petteruti Lounge
WHEN: Dec 12 (Wed) 7 pm

item.title: FREE, anonymous HIV testing THURSDAY, 12/13, 1-3
item.description: Health Services is offering anonymous, drop-in HIV testing for Brown students tomorrow, Thursday, 12/13, from 1pm-3pm, at the LGBTQ Center on the 3rd floor of the Campus Center. No appointment needed. No blood draw needed. Drop by on your lunch break! Results available in 40 minutes or less. The CDC recommends that all sexually active people get tested for HIV at least once a year.

item.title: Sign-ups NOW OPEN for SPRING MARKET SHARES
item.description: The Brown Market Shares Program is now accepting sign-ups for our SPRING SHARE! BMSP provides weekly shares of LOCAL, SUSTAINABLE produce, dairy, bread, eggs, and meat to members of the Brown community. The spring share runs ten weeks from February 7th to April 18th (excluding spring break). For more information and to sign up for a share, please visit our website below. Spots are limited and sign-ups/payment must be received by FEBRUARY 1st. A limited number of subsidized shares are available.

item.title: Summer Session 2013 Course Catalog Now Available
item.description:
Summer 2013 Course Catalog is now available, listing over 50 courses
for browsing.

Anticipate small class sizes, dynamic discussions, friendly student support, and plenty of time with your instructor during Brown's Summer Session. Begin your planning for the early registration period in April.

item.title: Cookies and Cider to Keep You Going
item.description: The Office of the Chaplains and Religious Life knows that the end of the semester is challenging, so we'd like to give you a little treat. Come by J. Walter Wilson Room 411 on Wednesday, December 12 or Thursday, December 13 anytime after 4:00pm. We'll have hot cider and cookies waiting for you!

item.title: Leave of Absence/December Completes
item.description:
If you are taking a leave of absence during 2nd semester, you need to file a mail forwarding request in Banner at My Personal Information page. This applies to educational as well as personal leaves. You also need to understand that you may lose your mailbox assignment while on leave and will be reassigned when you return to campus as an active student.
If you don't file a mail forwarding request all mail received while you are on leave will be returned to sender.
Thank you, Mail Services

item.title: December Completes
item.description:
If you have completed your degree requirements in December, you may use your mailbox during 2nd semester providing mail is picked up at least once a week.
If you will not be in Providence during 2nd semester, please file a mail forwarding request in Banner at My Personal Information page. The length of time that we'll forward mail will be Dec 2012 to Aug 2014. If you have any questions, please wtire to Mail_Services@brown.edu

item.title: Research Paper Help: Librarians After Dark Wed/Thu
item.description:
Working on a research paper? Stuck or want to dig up some new resources for your project? Not sure how to create your bibliography?

Extra help with subject librarians is available in the Friedman Center between 7-9 pm tonight, Wednesday 12/12 and tomorrow night Thursday 12/13. Drop in to get one-on-one research help.

When: Wednesday December 12, 7-9 pm
Thursday December 13, 7-9 pm
Where: Friedman Center, Level A in SciLi

Librarians After Dark is sponsored by the University Library

item.title: *TODAY* code4change: Tech, Entrepreneurship,Change
item.description:
Interested in Technology, Entrepreneurship and Social Change?

Want to use your coding skills for social good?

Want to intern in a NGO in Kenya?

Come to Code4change info session:
1pm, Wed Dec 12
CIT, Lubrano Room 477

Code4change networks students with 4 Kenyan NGOs and gives students the opportunity to apply their technological skills for social change in Kenya. Code4change is sponsored by the Swearer Centre for Public Service.

RSVP http://bit.ly/WYBHhw
Email achew@cs.brown.edu
